meanings.definition: The main air passages of the lungs.
meanings.sent1: The bronchia help us breathe by carrying air to our lungs.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the bronchia to understand how air moves in our bodies.
meanings.sent3: The bronchia were so excited to deliver fresh air to the lungs.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like bronchia carrying life-giving air.
meanings.sent5: In the quiet forest, the bronchia of the trees whispered secrets of the air.

meanings.definition: A tube that carries air to the lungs.
meanings.sent1: I felt a tickle in my bronchia as I took a deep breath.
meanings.sent2: The doctor inserted a tiny camera into the bronchia to see inside the lungs.
meanings.sent3: The bronchia in the car engine were clogged, causing it to sputter.
meanings.sent4: Her voice flowed smoothly, like air through clear bronchia.
meanings.sent5: The bronchia of the wind carried the scent of flowers from afar.

meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed out the bronchia on the X-ray of the patient's lungs.
meanings.sent2: The bronchia in his lungs were clear, indicating good respiratory health.
meanings.sent3: The bronchia in the anatomy model were labeled clearly for the students.
meanings.sent4: The bronchia of the respiratory system work together to ensure proper breathing.
meanings.sent5: The bronchia of the body form a complex network for air distribution.
